exits.description: A large gate lies to the north
exits.name: gate

title: The Courtyard Entrance
description:
This is the entrance to this small, fortified camp.  To the north stands a
thick gate with a large lock built into it.  Tall, stone walls surround the
courtyard here, which extends all around.  Atop the wall to the east and west
are wooden watchtowers where guards scan the surrounding countryside watching
for trouble.  The main part of this keep lies to the south, where a two-story
building sits, a portcullis leading  into it.  Red and black banners atop the
walls flap in the breeze and several soldiers wearing the same colors parade
around and train for an eventual fight.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This road seems to improve its condition as the big holes and bumps
disappear. This road continues to the east and the west and is packed hard
against the earth, as many a traveller has walked this way.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This narrow road is made from dirt. Many a traveller has walked these
roads before as the dirt is hard and packed down into the earth. Wagon tracks
are also visible on the road.

title: Bend in the Old Forest Road
description:
The road bends here but little else is different about it. An abandoned 
farmhouse is to the east as if somebody actually tried to live here. A large
shack is seen to the south-east.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This dirt road is very bumpy and contains many holes. Many pieces of wagons
lay strewn about as they have succumbed to the weariness of travel. Bones of
some animal are half-buried in the dirt, as somebody had dinner but didn't
bury the bones.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
The old forest road bends here heading to the south. To the west is a small
field which has grown up right by the road.. Lots of small animals and birds
chirp and cry out in the fields.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This old road has been well traveled in the past, and continues to be used
greatly today. This road continues to the east and west.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
Traveling this well-used road, enjoying the scenery of holes and large
bumps. The road continues to the east and the west.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
Birds and other small animals chirp and cry merrilily. Wagon tracks are seen
on the road as many a traveller has passed through this road. The road
seems to narrow up ahead.

title: Bend in the Old Forest Road
description:
This road is made of dirt and gravel. It contains many bumps and holes as
nature pounds it with it's fury every once in a while. Avoiding the bumps and
holes is very hard since the whole road has them in it.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This road takes you to the north or the east. Many pieces of wood lay about
as the people who made this road, just cut the trees down as fast as they could
without taking the wood with them.

title: Bend in the Old Forest Road
description:
Here and there you can see splintered wagon wheels as they have been 
shattered by some of the larger bumps and rocks in this road, as this road
is very primitive. As this road bends a large tree has fallen to the north.

title: Bend in the Old Forest Road
description:
This dirt and gravel road is worn well, many feet have trod where yours are
now. It is wide enough to contain 8 man abreast without any of them going off
the road. To the north the road continues.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
This old road is heavily traveled. It continues to the east and west. 
Wagon tracks can be seen on the road as many a merchant has traveled around
trying to sell his goods.

title: The Old Forest Road
description:
You are on an old dirt and gravel road that has been made by countless
people travelling down it. Many have not reached their destination as
bones of people lay near the road.

title: Hilly Plains
description:
A small path leads off from the Old Forest Road as many a traveller has
camped here for the night. Small and gentle rolling hills cover the area.
Small rabbits eat the green grass that grows.

title: A Large Shack
description:
This shack seems to have been abandoned the same time that the farmhouse was.
It is in better condition than the farmhouse as more care has been put into
the shack than the farmhouse. The person who lived in the farmhouse probably
kept his valuables in here.

title: Plains
description:
A well beaten path leads to the west where a large shack is seen. Somebody
must have lived around here for awhile and made this path. Small animals dart
to and fro.

title: Plains
description:
Finding your way through these plains is hard. Everywhere you look
plains surround you. Trusting in your mind to be able to find the way back
you continue.

exits.description: A huge, thick gate lies to the south.
exits.name: gate

title: Gate to the Encampment
description:
A large thick gate lies to the south, protecting something you can not see.
You wonder who would build a powerful gate in such a deserted area. The gate is
made out of some of the strongest metal you have ever seen and it looks brand new.

exits.description: Thick tree roots cover the ground.
exits.name: roots

title: At a Large Fallen Tree
description:
There is a large tree lying here.  Part of its roots have been tore up
with it when it fell over many years ago.  Much of the area around this tree
is clear with a few large rocks here and there.  You see some footprints in
some of the dirt around you.

title: Abandoned Farmhouse
description:
A door creaks loudly open as you approach. The house is about ready to 
collapse upon itself. The windows are all broken and there is no sign of any
furniture or clothes. The roof is going to cave into the house any minute.

title: Tree Tunnel
description:
You are in a tunnel that has been carved into this large fallen tree. The
walkway is covered in woodchips and the surrounding wood is in good condition
with no bugs or termites in it.  The tunnel leads down a short stairway to the
east.

title: Plains
description:
A small waterhole is located to the east, which surely draws all the animals
to it. To the west is an abandoned farmhouse, as if somebody actually tried to 
live here but failed miserably.

title: Small Waterhole
description:
A small pool of water lies here. It must be feed from an underground spring
because it never rains here. Many animals crowd around here to get a drink
of precious water.

title: Plains
description:
A dry and deserted plains stretch far. Small animals run about here and 
there. A small waterhole is to the south and it looks like the only place
to drink around here.

title: Plains
description:
Looking about for some sign of activity or life hardly anything is seen.
Wondering if anything could survive here for a period time and knowing that
it is false. The sky is directly overhead, nothing is in the way.

title: Plains
description:
Many animals wander these plains, to them it is there home. To the south
an old looking farmhouse rises above all else. The wildlife of the plains
areuniformly thin and tough to survive little food and water in the summer and
mind-bending cold in the winter.

title: Rolling Grasslands
description:
Small hills dot the landscape as the grasslands roll onward. Large paths
lay beaten into the dirt as people from all over travel these lands. Smoke
plumes from the plain to the north-east and you wonder what could live there.

title: Rolling Grasslands
description:
Hills go up and go down, in this ever changing landscape. To the east
the Old Forest Road lies. Small tracks of animals run around. Beaten paths
are seen as many a traveller has walked these routes.

title: Death's Lake
description:
Two large rocks protrude in the middle of this lake, forming the two eye
sockets of a rough skull, which is how this lake acquired its name. Cool,
rippling  waters entice many an animal to swim or drink its bountiful water.
This lake is big and one may have to use a boat to get across it.

title: The Grasslands
description:
Small animals run around in this wild grasslands. Huge grass grows 
everywhere as weeds fight for survival. To the south and west the Old Forest
Road runs.

title: The Grasslands
description:
Large amounts of grass, feed off the small pond to the north. The grass  is
about 4 feet tall with small thorns at the end. To the south is the Old Forest
Road. The ground is soft here and is pleasant to walk on, making the weary
traveler wish to lay down for a break from their travels.

title: A Pond
description:
This small pond feeds the trees that are around it. The animals drink here
and so they stick around. Small fish are seen swimming lazily throughout the
small pond. It is only 6 feet deep in the center.

title: The Grasslands
description:
Small animals run through this wild grassland to reach the small pond to
the east. To the west there is a large fallen tree. The heavy winds blow
the tops of the grass back and forth in a never ending cycle. Small paths
snake their wa between the grass have grown as many a people have traveled these
wonderful grasslands.

title: Endless Plains
description:
Dust flies up from underneath your feet as you're the first person to walk
these plains in a while. Plains wolves and other small animals built to
survive given little populate the plains as this is perfect environment for them.

title: Endless Plains
description:
Here stunted crops grow uselessly. Someone tried to farm here but finally
learned that it was useless to grow things in this arid place. Dust flies
up in the air where you are stepping.

title: Plains
description:
Nothing lives here, no vegetation and no animals. Walking through
these quiet grasses, the only sounds heard are footsteps and armour jiggling. It
is still and deathly quiet. Far to the north the Old Forest Road can be seen.

title: Plains
description:
Small grass actually grows here, feeding off the pond. The pond is formed
by the water that slides down the large hill to the east. Far to the north
the Old Forest Road can be seen. The usually flat plain gets hilly here, gaining
elevation from long past movements of the earth.

title: A Small Hideout
description:
There is a small area dug out here.  The walls, ceiling, and floor have
been covered by stone to make things more stable.  There is a table here and
a few chairs.  On the ground are scraps of cloth and garbage.  This must be
a small meeting place for some people who wanted to keep it secret.

title: Light Forest
description:
The winds from the lake head into the forest where it eventually dies.
Death's Lake to the north feeds this whole forest with water, which allows
it to grow in this usually barren landscape. Small and large animals call this
forest home.

title: Rolling Grasslands
description:
The grasslands continue but are dotted with large and small hills. To the 
south the Old Forest Road is found. But to the north a strange looking tent
with a small fire lies.

title: Grasslands
description:
The grass continues as far as the eye can see, blowing in the wind like a
gaint sea, waves of green flowing up and down.  There are signs of a small
camp that had been set up here in the past, including a small still-burning
fire.

title: Light Forest
description:
Large animals hide under the cover of the trees. To the far north is 
Death's Lake which feeds this rapidly growing forest. Some trees have been cut
down to make a wall that you can see from here.

title: Dirty Street
description:
This small road winds it's way through this small village. It is made
out of dirt but the falling rains have made it mud. As people walk in it
they track mud everywhere but they don't seem to mind.

title: Light Forest
description:
Trees seem to have been cut down here, with many stumps laying about.
To the west, you can see why, a huge wooden wall stops you from going in that
direction. Many trees still grow here even though about half of them were
cut down.

title: A Dirt Street
description:
To the north and south houses stretch in a straight line, totaling about
fourteen. Many of the houses are abandoned and some are completely ruined. To
the dismay of many people the guards patrol right by their house.

title: A Dirt Street
description:
Row after row of houses stretch to the north. Patrols continuosly walk
down the streets protecting the citizens from anything and everything. To the 
west a small dirt street lies.

title: Light Forest
description:
Trees grow here, with help from the bountiful supply of water from
the lake nearby. The trees provide cover from they sky, and hide small animals
from the predators that lurk nearby.

title: Dirt Street
description:
A small narrow dirt street feeds itself through this small town. Wagons 
and carts get stuck, as the mud grabs ahold and will not let go. Many people
walk these streets which cause them to become dirty and muddy.

title: Plains
description:
To the north and east the Old Forest Road lies. But to the west a small 
waterhole that is visited by many animals is there. The heat is unbearable
in this killer plains. Breathing is like inhaling dust, the air is so dry.

title: Small Hut
description:
This small hut is in the middle of nowhere. Somebody actually tried to live
in this deserted place, but found that this place is uninhabitable. Cracked 
wooden boards lay forgotten nearby, never to be used again. Rusted weapons and
tools lay scattered about, as the owner seem to have forgotten them.

title: Plains
description:
Wide open land lays around. Nobody ever seems to disturb this peacefulness 
and the small animals that live here only look for food and drink. To the north
the Old Forest Road bends.

title: Plains
description:
Occasionally small plants grow but not a lot. The soil is getting richer
the more east you get but still not allowing more than small shrubs to grow.
Farther to the east trees are seen. To the north the Old Forest Road lies.

exits.description: A large tower rises to the east.

title: Prairie
description:
Small trees try to grow here but the soil will not let them. Mostly small
bushes and scrub plants grow here. Small animals can be seen eating the
leaves of them. To the north the Old Forest Road lies.

title: Plains
description:
Small animals hurry to get out of they way, as they are frightened to death
by seeing you. Small grass grow nearby as water seems to become more available,
as you can see a large lake to the south-east.

title: Prairie Outside a Tower
description:
Large bushes and medium sized trees grow in this small prairie.
Sounds of running water are heard to the south, which allows the slight growth
of the vegetation. Looking to the west all that can be seen are dry and deserted
plains.

title: Plains
description:
Animal footprints cover the ground. Entering territory that has never been
disturbed by a human before. Large tracks lead to the south while most of them
are little footprints like foxes and wolves.

title: Plains
description:
Large vegetation grow here as they feed off Death's Lake. To the south
a small forest has grown up over the years. Here small animals feed off
the vegetation and drink the water equally, and they equally run from the
occasional predator that comes hunting.

title: A Large Hill
description:
This hill is exhausting to climb as the grade is steep. All the rain that 
falls slides down the hill onto the lands below creating small ponds. Several 
goats and animals that like high places can be seen wandering around here.

title: Plains
description:
A large hill stands out to the west. A semi-small pond is here because
all the water slides down the hill onto here. Small animals can be seen 
drinking out of the pond, relieving their thirst. To the south a strange
wooden wall is seen blocking that direction off.

title: Plains
description:
Small bushes dot the landscape and small animals creep through them.
The animals chirp with fright and flee from the sight of you. To the 
south lies a huge wooden wall, which you can not climb over.

title: Plains
description:
Nothing is alive here. All the vegetation is brown and small animal's 
corpses lay on the ground. To the south a strange looking wooden wall prevents
you from going in that direction.

title: Field
description:
Large fields of food grow around here, enough to feed a entire village.
Small irrigation canals feed the plants with water. The water is coming from
the south-west. To the east a large wooden wall looms overhead.

title: Fields
description:
Workers hoe and chop at the soil in an attempt to loosen it up, to allow
the planting of plants. To the south a large pond has many small irrigation
canals going all over the place, to feed the surrounding fields with water.

title: Fields
description:
Farmers toil away, planting and harvesting a lot of food. Workers can be
seen taking the food to the east and into a large encampment. Irrigation canals
feed the fields with precious water. A large wooden wall lies to the east which
blocks off that direction.

title: Fields
description:
Fields of plants bend here and there as the wind knocks them around. Farmers
toil away, creating the precious substance known as food. Large irrigation
canals feed their way through the many fields as it gives water to the plants.
A large wooden wall blocks off the way to the east.

title: The Fountain
description:
A large fountain sits here within the courtyard, water flowing freely from
it into a large basin.  It is here that the residents of this keep draw their
water from.   To the south looms a tall stone structure, a windowless
two-story building.  An iron portcullis is the only visible entrance, a small
open-air entryway visible upon the other side of it.  The courtyard spreads
out to the north where a large gate leads outside the keep.

title: The Courtyard
description:
A wide courtyard fills much of the area inside these stone walls.  Large
slabs of grey slate have been layed down upon the ground, providing a smooth
surface to walk on devoid of mud during times of rain.  The front gate can be
seen to the west, while above sits a wooden structure perched atop the walls.

title: The Courtyard
description:
The tall, stone walls of the keep meet here in the northeast corner of the
camp.  A wooden watchtower sits atop the walls above here, where a guard
stands watching for intruders or attackers.  Several soldiers walk around the
courtyard to the south and east, training with one another and discussing
various topics.

title: The Courtyard
description:
A tall stone wall lies to the west butting up against a building to the
south.  The remainder of this courtyard stretches to the north and east,
covered by slabs of  slate.  A fountain sprays water into the air east of here
and several soldiers can be seen patroling the area.  Wooden watchtowers sit
atop the walls to the north and  northeast.

title: Fields
description:
Large fields of crops lay in ruin, as the irrigation canals failed to work.
The water didn't come as expected and this field was abandoned to the carrion as
other fields produced bountiful crops..

title: The Courtyard
description:
A stone wall rises high to the east, where red and black banners flap in
the breeze.  To the south, a tall building made of the same material as the
walls looms above the courtyard.  No windows can be seen within it, only a
portcullis to the west allows entrance inside.  A stone fountain sits in the
middle of the courtyard before the portcullis.

title: The Watchtower
description:
Sitting atop the stone walls of the keep, this structure is a watchtower
meant to house a guard that scans the distances looking for possible trouble.
A large courtyard lies below, surfaced with a grey slate.  A two-story
building sits to the south of the courtyard, a portcullis leading into it.
Several soldiers wearing the colors of Thog Bloodsbane, black on red, patrol
the courtyard.

title: The Watchtower
description:
Within this wooden structure, a guard is posted to watch the surrounding
countyside for possible threats.  A vast, grassy plain stretches out in all
directions away from the keep.  A thin forest of trees can be seen in the
distance.  Anyone approaching  will be seen long before they reach the front
gate and the camp's inhabitants can be warned.

title: Open Entryway
description:
This open-air entryway is the entrance to the main portion of Thog's keep.
It is floored with the same slate rock as the courtyard to the north, which
lies on the other side of an iron portcullis.  A corral leads to the stables
south of here,  while doors to the east and west lead into the main building.

title: The Armory
description:
This is the keep's armory, where extra weapons are stored for emergencies.
Because of the small size of this encampment, it also is used as a smithy
where the weapons are made.  Metal armor is also made and stored here, so that
this place is very  important to Thog and his men.  To protect their
equipment, a steeldoor has been placed to the west.  To the south, a doorway
leads to a flight of stairs.

title: Dining Hall
description:
A long oaken table takes up most of this room, its surface unfinished and
rough. Years of spilled food and drink stain the surface in large patches.
Several crude chairs surround it, some tipped over on the floor.  Wooden
plates and goblets sit on the table, filled with uneaten food and drink.  A
large cast-iron stove sits in the northwest corner, a pipe leading from it
through the ceiling.

title: Barracks
description:
The walls of this room are lined with several double bunks, each bed facing
the opposite direction of the next.  Footlockers lie upon the floor at the end
of each bunk, filled only with spare clothing.  No windows sit in the walls
and the only exit is the door to the north.

title: The Stable
description:
Dirty straw and hay lies scattered throughout the several stalls here. Each
houses a horse used by the soldiers here when travelling from the keep. Water
troughs and feed trays line the inside of the stalls and a block of salt rests
on the floor.  Tack and harnesses hang from pegs on the walls.

title: The Stairwell
description:
A curved flight of stone stairs leads upwards here as well as down below
the main keep.  Brass sconces line the walls, filled with unlit torches.  A
wooden door leads northward to the keep's armory, where weapons and armor are
stored until needed at a later time.  The absence of dust on the floor shows
that these stairs are used often by the inhabitants of this place.

title: The Dungeon
description:
A circular flight of stairs leads upward into the main part of the keep,
its steps built of blocks of grey stone.  This is Thog's dungeon, where he
keeps those he finds wandering too close to his camp.  Two cells can be seen
here, one to the west and the other to the northwest.  A terrible stench fills
the room.

title: The Jailor's Corner
description:
This corner of the dungeon contains a small table and a chair.  Various
implements of torture hang from the walls on wooden pegs, blood staining their
surfaces.  A flight of stairs leads upward into the ceiling to the north and
two cells can be seen to the west and southwest.

title: A Prison Cell
description:
This cell appears to have been used recently.  Fresh blood pools in a dark
patch in the center of the room.  Dirty straw covers the floor, mixed with
excrement and rotten food.  A few words have been scrawled into the stone
walls, though their meaning is uncertain.  An iron cell door leads to the
west.

title: A Prison Cell
description:
This small cell is covered with a thin layer of dirty straw, blood and
excrement staining the floor in large patches.  Rats scurry into a small hole
in the floor at the sign of visitors here.  A terrible odor fills one's
nostrils, one of rot and decay.  An iron cell door to the east is the only
exit out of here.

title: A Short Hallway
description:
Turning to the south and east, this short passage winds its way through the
upper stories of the keep.  A door stands to the west, voices coming from
behind it. Another door can be seen to the south along the same wall.  Various
footprints can be seen in the thin layer of dust on the floor.

title: A Short Hallway
description:
This small passage leads to the west where it rounds a corner and a door
can be  seen, and to the south where a flight of stairs leads downward.  Unlit
torches sit in sconces on the walls, covered in a thin layer of dust.  Voices
can be heard around the corner to the west.

title: Atop the Stairwell
description:
A circular flight of stairs leads downward here, its stone steps devoid of
dust. This implies that it is used often by the inhabitants of the keep.
Sconces hang on the walls, unlit torches sitting within.  A doorway leads to
the north, where sounds of talking can be heard emanating from.

title: The Map Room
description:
Several wooden tables sit in this room.  Various maps of the plains
surrounding the keep, Vinyanost, and the Mirkwood lie scattered across these
tables and hang on the walls.  Tiny metal pieces mark locations key to Thog's
plans.  A plate of uneaten food and a half-filled goblet sit near a
well-marked map of Vinyanost.

title: A Short Hallway
description:
The passage ends here, where a well-built door stands in the western wall.
The  hinges on the door appear amply oiled and the floor is devoid of dust,
indicating that this room is used often.  Sconces on the wall contain unlit
torches and a large painting of the renegade leader, Thog Bloodsbane, hangs on
the eastern wall across from the door.

title: Thog's Chambers
description:
This room is quite large and extravagently decorated.  A wide, four-poster
bed sits against the western wall, covered in dark red silk sheets. Tapestries
hang on the  walls, woven with golden thread and studded with rare gems.  A
circular table carved from a rich, dark wood sits in the middle of the room,
four chairs positioned around it.  A cherry wardrobe sits against the south
wall, handsomely carved and stained. A plush, handsome carpet covers the hard,
cold stone floor.  It has been dyed black on red, the color of Thog's renegade
army.
